title.narrative: CLIMATE CHANGE CAP BLDING FOR WIN PACJA

description.narrative: A continental coalition of Civil Society Organizations from diverse backgrounds in African, the Pan African Climate Justice Alliance has emerged as the most vibrant and largest Civil Society platform on climate change and sustainable development. With a membership of more than 500 organisations and networks, the Alliance brings together Faith-based Organisations, farmers and pastoralists groups, Community-based Organisations, Non-Governmental Organisations, among other sectors with a common goal of promoting and advocating for Pro-poor, climate-friendly and equity-based responses to climate change. PACJA aims at unifying and coordinating isolated civil society efforts on climate change advocacy in Africa, seek to mainstream climate change into national poverty reduction and sustainable development strategies and actions. Due to the expansion of the Alliance, a strategic planning meeting held in September 2012 recommended that CSOs in various countries congregate themselves into national platforms that subsequently are represented at continental level by one representative. This was ratified during the General Assembly held in February 2013, which reaffirmed the Alliance#s resolve to strengthen national platforms to ease coordination and act as central pillars of PACJA at national level. A single national network or trans boundary sectoral network where they exist may represent hundreds of other members. The strategy seeks to deliver four key results: Sufficiently improved capacity and efficiency in the attainment of the mission, vision and objectives of theorganization; Pro-poor climate change response policies and strategies taken on board at National and Regional levels; Equitable, people-centred and ambitious international climate policies/strategies responsive to African realities and concerns realised; Enhanced and positive media coverage of Africa climate change issues attained as to ensure that pro-poor and people-centred response measures are given attention as governments in Africa

participating-org.narrative:
PACJA is the Pan African Climate Justice Alliance, an alliance of African NGO's and social movements from different African countries, that is campaigining for a fair international climate deal. PACJA is an aliance of Oxfam in efforts to influence the global climate negotiations, so that there will be a favourable outcome for the most vulnerable countries.
NB : The rest of the classification data (such as gender) are filled out in the system, but are not based on in-depth assesments. PACJA is not a regular PAF partner, but a one-off project (WSF 2011 funding).
